document_data.name: Alamarayne Moonray
document_data.mainbody: '''Alamarayne Moonray''' was a priestess of [[Selûne]] residing in [[Elmwood]]. She assisted [[Dorn Graybrook]] and [[Karasendrieth]] in repelling the [[Zhentilar]] that occupied her village in the {{yearlinkName|1373}}.
document_data.Description: Alamarayne was a beauty, and she had a pure laugh, described as "like liquid moonlight" in 1367 DR.{{cite book/The Rage||17}}
document_data.Abilities: Alamarayne had employed divinations to determine the capabilities of the [[Zhentilar]] forces occupying Elmwood, ascertaining that they may have divinatory powers of their own.{{cite book/The Rage||17}} When fighting the Zhents, she employed such spells as [[hold person]] and [[dismissal]].{{cite book/The Rage||19}}
document_data.Personality: Alamarayne did not flaunt her beauty. She had a mischievous streak. Per [[Will Turnstone]], she was merry and even coquettish, though she could be as cheery as a mass grave sometimes.{{cite book/The Rage||18}}
document_data.Activities: In {{yearlink|1367}} Alamarayne was the priestess at the [[Temple of the Half Moon]] of Elmwood. In that year, she also met once a week with [[Thoyana Jorgadaul]] at the [[Still Waters]] for conversation, dinner, and a game of chess, but those were different meetings than the ones with Ezril.{{cite book/The Moonsea/Player's Guide|22}}
document_data.Relationships: In {{yearlink|1367}}, Alamarayne Moonray spent a few pleasant evenings adeptly researchcing the effects of moonlight on romantic situations with Mendryll Belarod.{{cite book/The Moonsea/Player's Guide|22}} She eventually stood him up just as he was going to tell her about noises he heard coming from the village well.{{cite book/The Moonsea/Player's Guide|23}}
document_data.History: In {{yearlink|1373}}, she was assisted by [[Dorn Graybrook]]'s party in ridding Elmwood of the occupying force sent from [[Zhentil Keep]] in a conquering bid intended to take advantage of the [[Rage of Dragons]] between [[Tarsakh 11]] and [[Tarsakh 12]].
